latest_revision.text:
*'''Station Champions:''' David Flores (Training), Nate Caine (Maintenance)
*'''Communication:''' Slack #lasering channel
*'''Certification:''' 4th Friday of every Month 7pm - 10pm
*'''Events:''' N/A

==Overview==

HeatSync Labs has an '''[[Large_80W_Laser | 80 Watt Laser Cutter]]''' and '''[[Mini_60W_Laser | 60 Watt Laser Cutter]]'''. You must be certified to use the laser cutter on your own.

As you have questions using the laser please consider using our '''[[Laser_FAQ | Laser FAQ page]]'''. By having a single searchable page things will be easier for everyone.

If there are problems that cause the laser not to be safe to use; Discuss with whoever is hosting open hours. Post a sign on the laser if it's out of order. Then post on Slack in the laser channel about the problem.

The [[:Category:Laser | Laser Category ]] page lists all articles on our wiki about the laser cutters. Some may be outdated.

==Expectations==
There are plenty of safety and other considerations covered in our training class. Here are some highlights.

* Always stay in the area when your job is running in case you need to hit the E-Stop or respond to a problem or fire
* Clean up after your job
* Log your work when you are done
* Empty the trash out in the dumpster when it is 3/4 full
* Take turns with others
* Be courteous of volunteers hosting and be cleaned up by the end of open hours

==Events==
Some of the current and past events for the laser cutter:
*Laser Certification on the 4th Friday every month.
*[[Laser_Meetup | Laser Meetup]] 2nd Sunday of every month
*[[Build-A-Bot | Build-A-Bot series]]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/712497 Laser Cut Box Making]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/723270 Laser Engraved Stamp Making]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/741495 Young Maker Laser Portraits]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/750477 Earring Making with the Laser Cutter]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/733125 Snowflake Earring Making]
*[https://guestlist.co/events/743007 LaserCut 5.3 Hands-On Class]
